head.title: An Opposing View Of Restaurant's Meals

hedline.hl1: An Opposing View Of Restaurant's Meals

abstract.p: Sonya Breidbart letter disputes M H Reed's review of Emilio restaurant (S)0

block.p: How can I help thinking that M. H. Reed is recognized when a photographer is in tow for a restaurant review? I suspect that restaurants identify the reviewer even on earlier visits. How else can you explain why the reviewer seems to get meals different from what we are served?

The review of Emilio last Sunday illustrates that point for me. We used to eat there fairly often. I especially loved the ravioli with swiss chard. The last times we ate there, the sauce tasted like paste.
